org.nodes.algorithms

Class SlashBurn<N>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodes.algorithms.SlashBurn<N>
  • Type Parameters:
    N - 

    public class SlashBurn<N>
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the Slash-and-burn algorithm of Kang and Faloutsos.
    Author:
    Peter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SlashBurn.SignatureComparator<L,T>
      Compares nodes based on degree, filtered by tag and direction.

        public static <L,T> java.util.List<DTNode<L,T>> getHubs(DTGraph<L,T> graph,
                                        int k,

      • getHubs

        public static <L,T> java.util.List<DTNode<L,T>> getHubs(DTGraph<L,T> graph,
                                        int k,
                                        int iterations,
                                        boolean useSignatures)
        Returns the hubs in a given graph, according to a run of the slashburn algorithm.
        Parameters:
        graph -
        k - The number of hubs to slash per iteration
        iterations - The maximum number of iteration (the algorithm may finish earlier)
        useSignatures - A signature is a combination if direction and tag for a given link If true, the degree of a node is the size of the largest wet of links with the same signature. If false, the basic degree is used.
        Returns:

      • primeSignature

        public static <L,T> Pair<Functions.Dir,T> primeSignature(DTNode<L,T> node)
        The prime signature of a node in a directed, tagged graph is the combination of 'in/out' and a tag which occurs most frequently among all links connected to the node.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
